title: Mono_2H_MP_BR1
source_name_ch1: Peripheral blood monocytes from adult
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated by extraction with TRIzol Reagent (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Cat. No. 15596018) followed by column-based purification with the RNA Clean & Concentrator-5 kit (Zymo Research; Cat. No. R1016).
extract_protocol_ch1.1: RNA libraries were prepared with the Illumina TruSeq Stranded Total RNA with Ribo-Zero Gold Library Preparation Kit (Illumina, Cat. No. RS-122-2303).
data_processing: bcl to FASTQ file conversion was performed with bcl2fastq2 v. 2.20
data_processing.1: Starting with the untrimmed FASTQ files (provided as raw files with this GEO entry), adapter-sequence trimming was performed with Cutadapt v. 1.10 on Python v. 2.7.9. Cutadapt parameters and adapter sequences: -a AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC -A AGATCGGAAGAGCGTCGTGTAGGGAAAGAGTGT -m 20
data_processing.2: Alignment of the adapter-trimmed reads was performed with STAR v. 2.6. Reference genome assembly: GRCh38 reference assembly. Transcript annotation: GENCODE28 (gencode.v28.primary_assembly.annotation.gtf)
data_processing.3: Generation of a matrix of aligned-read counts was performed with featureCounts, which is part of the Subread package v. 1.5.3. featureCounts parameters: -p -B -s 2 -T 8 -O -t exon -g gene_name. Transcript annotation: GENCODE28 (gencode.v28.primary_assembly.annotation.gtf)
data_processing.4: Generation of abundance measurements (read counts) normalized by library size was performed with the R package DESeq2 v. 1.18.1, in R v. 3.5.0. Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu (64-bit)
data_processing.6: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A file with processed data is provided: GSE112101_NormalizedReadCounts.txt. The values in the file are read counts normalized by library size by the median-of-ratios method implemented in DESeq2. The file contains a table with 58,765 rows and 13 columns. The first row is a header row and it is followed by 56,870 rows, each corresponding to one transcript. The first column has the transcript identifiers (corresponding to the GENCODE28 annotation file: gencode.v28.primary_assembly.annotation.gtf) and it is followed by 144 columns, one for each sample. A separate file with un-normalized read counts is also provided: GSE112101_RawReadCounts.txt.

data_processing: bcl to FASTQ file conversion was performed with bcl2fastq2 v. 2.20
data_processing.1: Starting with the untrimmed FASTQ files (provided as raw files with this GEO entry), adapter-sequence trimming was performed with Cutadapt v. 1.10 on Python v. 2.7.9. Cutadapt parameters and adapter sequences: -a AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC -A AGATCGGAAGAGCGTCGTGTAGGGAAAGAGTGT -m 20
data_processing.2: Alignment of the adapter-trimmed reads was performed with STAR v. 2.6. Reference genome assembly: GRCh38 reference assembly. Transcript annotation: GENCODE28 (gencode.v28.primary_assembly.annotation.gtf)
data_processing.3: Generation of a matrix of aligned-read counts was performed with featureCounts, which is part of the Subread package v. 1.5.3. featureCounts parameters: -p -B -s 2 -T 8 -O -t exon -g gene_name. Transcript annotation: GENCODE28 (gencode.v28.primary_assembly.annotation.gtf)
data_processing.4: Generation of abundance measurements (read counts) normalized by library size was performed with the R package DESeq2 v. 1.18.1, in R v. 3.5.0. Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu (64-bit)
data_processing.6: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A file with processed data is provided: GSE112101_NormalizedReadCounts.txt. The values in the file are read counts normalized by library size by the median-of-ratios method implemented in DESeq2. The file contains a table with 58,765 rows and 13 columns. The first row is a header row and it is followed by 56,870 rows, each corresponding to one transcript. The first column has the transcript identifiers (corresponding to the GENCODE28 annotation file: gencode.v28.primary_assembly.annotation.gtf) and it is followed by 144 columns, one for each sample. A separate file with un-normalized read counts is also provided: GSE112101_RawReadCounts.txt.
